sen.e: Heinai ORITA (January or February 1847 - May 7, 1905) was a statesman in the Meiji era.

sen.e: He was also appointed by the government as the governor of many prefectures such as Yamagata Prefecture, Fukushima Prefecture, Tochigi Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture and Shiga Prefecture.

sen.e: Heinai was born in January or February 1847 in Yamashita-cho, Kagoshima County, Satsuma Province.

sen.j: 1872年12月 (旧暦)に開拓使八等出仕となる。
sen.e: In January 1873 Heinai became a "hatto" (a lower-level official) to the Hokkaido Development Commission.
In December 1872 Heinai became a "hatto" (a lower-level official) to the Hokkaido Development Commission.

sen.e: In December 1872 Heinai became a "hatto" (a lower-level official) to the Hokkaido Development Commission.

sen.j: 1872年8月 (旧暦)に開拓使大主典、1873年10月に七等出仕となり、1875年8月8日に開拓幹事。
sen.e: In September 1872 Heinai became a "daisokan"(another lower-level official), in October 1873 a "nanato" (higher than hatto) to the Hokkaido Development Commission and in August 8, 1875, he became Development executive.

sen.e: When the Hokkaido Development Commission was abolished, Heinai became a higher-ranked secretary to the Ministry of Home Affairs.
